metadata.synopsis: Having discovered the true identity of the Emperor (Balduran), one final confrontation with the Emperor about its manipulation in which we learn of how Balduran came to be the Emperor.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Open ORI Debugbook (CTRL SHIFT 7)Daisy > Act 3 - Baldur's Gate > Emperor Balduran After teleport, pick up helmet, go through dialog.KillcombatPick up helmet again.

0.speaker: The Emperor
0.text: Ansur - I never thought I'd see him again.
0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Emperor starts a mindmeld. 
Shot of Balduran on the front of his ship, the Wandering Eye.

46.speaker: Player
46.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Emperor starts a mindmeld. 
Shot of Balduran on the front of his ship, the Wandering Eye.

38.speaker: The Emperor
38.text: I was. Now I am much much more.
38.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Emperor starts a mindmeld. 
Shot of Balduran on the front of his ship, the Wandering Eye.

50.speaker: The Emperor
50.text: But it seems you are more interested in my past.
50.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Emperor starts a mindmeld. 
Shot of Balduran on the front of his ship, the Wandering Eye.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: You literally founded Baldur's Gate - of course I'm interested!
55.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Emperor starts a mindmeld. 
Shot of Balduran on the front of his ship, the Wandering Eye.

56.speaker: The Emperor
56.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Emperor starts a mindmeld. 
Shot of Balduran on the front of his ship, the Wandering Eye.

43.speaker: The Emperor
43.text: It's like I always told you - I was just like you. An adventurer who yearned for greatness. And in mortal terms, I achieved it.
43.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Emperor starts a mindmeld. 
Shot of Balduran on the front of his ship, the Wandering Eye.

9.speaker: The Emperor
9.text: As Captain of the Wandering Eye I acquired enough gold to found Baldur's Gate.
9.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Emperor starts a mindmeld. 
Shot of Balduran on the front of his ship, the Wandering Eye.

8.speaker: The Emperor
8.text: I stayed for a while, to watch my city grow, but it was not enough. I grew restless again. The sea called to me, and I ran to her with open arms.

52.speaker: The Emperor
52.text: Life at sea was not easy. Our last adventure was ruinous. My ship was destroyed, my crew lost, but my spirit was far from broken.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: moving still of the ship in the middle of a cataclysmic storm

22.speaker: The Emperor
22.text: I was determined to return in triumph once again - I heard of treasure in Moonrise. I strove to find it.
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Moving still of Balduran walking away from a shipwreck / towards Moonrise with a map.

44.speaker: The Emperor
44.text: What I found was an illithid colony, where I acquired a tadpole much like yours, and became a mind flayer, enthralled to the elder brain.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Moving still of Balduran being tadpoled.

64.speaker: The Emperor
64.text: It was Ansur who found me, Ansur who pulled me from the brain's domination, Ansur who brought me home.
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Moving still of Ansur pulling mind flayer Balduran from the hivemind.

54.speaker: The Emperor
54.text: He sought to cure me of my sickness, called on every healer he could find, nearly broke his spirit in the attempt.

32.speaker: The Emperor
32.text: But he failed to understand - I wanted no healing. I was not sick.
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld ends on Emperor in his Illithid form.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Don't you feel bad about killing the one who saved you?

26.speaker: The Emperor
26.text: Of course I do. More so because it was Ansur.

37.speaker: The Emperor
37.text: Even after he had exhausted all possibility of reversing my condition, he still clung to hope.

28.speaker: The Emperor
28.text: I tried to convince him of my reality - I was on the cusp of greatness beyond my wildest dreams. But all he could see was a mind flayer.

5.speaker: The Emperor
5.text: He came to me as I slept - a mercy killing, in his mind. I saw the tears - I felt his grief.

59.speaker: The Emperor
59.text: I had no choice but to kill him first - it was an act of self-preservation.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I'm sorry you had to go through that.

42.speaker: The Emperor
42.text: I hope I never find myself in that situation again.

17.speaker: The Emperor
17.text: While the past is beyond my influence, the present is not.
17.context: NodeContext: pulling back into the present

4.speaker: The Emperor
4.text: It is time we move on.
4.context: NodeContext: pulling back into the present

31.speaker: The Emperor
31.text: We must find it, before the brain breaks free.

13.speaker: The Emperor
13.text: Two Netherstones remain in the hands of the Chosen.

19.speaker: The Emperor
19.text: We must find them before we confront the brain.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Is being an illithid really worth the loss of a friend?

25.speaker: The Emperor
25.text: Put simply - yes. And being alive is even more so.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: You could have done the honourable thing and let him kill you.

53.speaker: The Emperor
53.text: Words easier said than lived by.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I admire your commitment to survival, but your methods are questionable.

10.speaker: The Emperor
10.text: There were no alternatives. In my place you would have done the same.

63.speaker: The Emperor
63.text: Do not think that I am ignorant of what I have lost. I may not regret my actions, but I do regret that they were necessary.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Makes sense. I would have done the same.

48.speaker: The Emperor
48.text: I am glad you see it that way.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Ansur, Stelmane. Do your allies always die?

61.speaker: The Emperor
61.text: Stelmane's death was not my fault.

14.speaker: The Emperor
14.text: Ansur's death was born of necessity.

33.speaker: The Emperor
33.text: And make no mistake - I grieve them both. Ansur in particular.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I want to know everything there is to know about you.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I just need to know if you're going to kill me like you killed your last 'friend'.

7.speaker: The Emperor
7.text: I killed Ansur out of necessity.

62.speaker: The Emperor
62.text: For the crime of being an illithid, he would have killed me first.

18.speaker: The Emperor
18.text: We have enough to worry about in the present.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Why did you conceal your true identity from me?

21.speaker: The Emperor
21.text: My true identity is the one you've known from the moment we met.

11.speaker: The Emperor
11.text: I concealed nothing from you. I simply left out the details that were not pertinent to our cause.

12.speaker: The Emperor
12.text: But it seems you are interested in them.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: How much more of your past are you not telling me about?
